thread.title: Roseburg native Jeremy Guthrie offers prayers to victims, famili
thread.title_full: Roseburg native Jeremy Guthrie offers prayers to victims, famili - KCTV5

author: DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Roseburg native Jeremy Guthrie offers prayers to victims, famili
text:
CHICAGO (KCTV) - The shooting at the Oregon community college struck especially close to home for Royals pitcher Jeremy Guthrie.
Guthrie was born in Roseburg and said he spent considerable amount of time at Umpqua Community College while he was growing up. His father sold cars in the area. He graduated from a high school in Ashland, which is two hours south of Roseburg.
"Another tragic shooting. This one hits home being from Roseburg. Spent a lot of time on UCC campus as a kid," Guthrie wrote on his Twitter account.
He added the symbol for prayers at the end of his post. Click here to view his tweets.
Before the Royals played the White Sox Thursday night, Guthrie remembered swimming at the college pool with his brothers and watching baseball games at the school.
"I'm sure they are going through a lot of pain. I'm sure a lot of people and families are connected to some of the victims," Guthrie said. "We are thinking of them. We are prayful especially those who were directly impacted. Those families are going through an unimaginable loss today."
He said he violence is never the answer and it's happened too often.
"You just hope that at some point in time we as a society and we as a people can learn to cope with struggles and difficulties and challenges in our lives in a different way," he said. "All of us go through struggles. All of us have challenges. Maybe we can show a little more love and compassion to those going through other things. Hopefully the end result is we can stop having to witness these types of tragedies."
He said he was on a mission trip in Spain when he heard about the mass shooting at Columbine High School in 1999. He said he couldn't comprehend it or understand it. He said now youth are use to hearing about school shootings.
You can leave your condolences for the victims on our Facebook page. Click here.
